page.title: 01S.W.GUILDFORD:GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: The area consists mainly of farmland. In this rural area are few major roads but many paths, including the long distance path, the North Downs Way. The town of Guildford, however, is linked with London and Winchester by the A3 and A31 roads respectively. There are many historic buildings in Guildford and its surroundings including the 12th century castle, 17th century Guildhall and other fine buildings _ especially churches _ in and around the High Street. Loseley House, outside the town, is open to the public and exports dairy produce countrywide. Guildford is a prosperous social and commercial centre, while remaining a beautiful town, with many fine buildings surrounded by a peaceful countryside. Fionnuala O'Conor
